intro: Jackiopsis, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plants are characterized by their low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves. They produce small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, and their seeds are dispersed by wind. Jackiopsis species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
